net.consensys.cava.config

Class SchemaBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.consensys.cava.config.SchemaBuilder

  • public final class SchemaBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    This interface allows customers to determine a schema to associate with a configuration to validate the entries read from configuration files, and provide default values if no value is present in the configuration file.

    • Method Summary

      • documentProperty

        public SchemaBuilder documentProperty(java.lang.String key,
                                      java.lang.String description)
        Provide documentation for a property.

        Invoking this method with the same key as a previous invocation will replace the description for that key.

        Parameters:
        key - The configuration property key.
        description - The description to associate with the property.
        Returns:
        This builder.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the key cannot be parsed.

      • validateProperty

        public SchemaBuilder validateProperty(java.lang.String key,
                                      PropertyValidator<java.lang.Object> validator)
        Add a property validation to this schema.

        Multiple validators can be provided for the same key by invoking this method multiple times.

        Parameters:
        key - The configuration property key.
        validator - A validator for the property.
        Returns:
        This builder.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the key cannot be parsed.

      • validateConfiguration

        public SchemaBuilder validateConfiguration(ConfigurationValidator validator)
        Add a configuration validator to the schema.

        Multiple validators can be provided by invoking this method multiple times.

        Parameters:
        validator - A configuration validator.
        Returns:
        This builder.

      • addString

        public SchemaBuilder addString(java.lang.String key,
                               @Nullable
                               java.lang.String defaultValue,
                               @Nullable
                               java.lang.String description,
                               @Nullable
                               PropertyValidator<? super java.lang.String> validator)
        Add a string property to the schema.

        Even if no validator is provided, the schema will validate that the configuration property, if present, contains a string.

        If a defaultValue is provided, then the provided validator, if any, will only be invoked if the value is present (i.e. it will not be provided a null value to validate).

        Parameters:
        key - The configuration property key.
        defaultValue - A default value for the property or null if no default is provided.
        description - The description to associate with this property, or null if no documentation is provided.
        validator - A validator for the property, or null if no validator is provided.
        Returns:
        This builder.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the key cannot be parsed.

      • addListOfString

        public SchemaBuilder addListOfString(java.lang.String key,
                                     @Nullable
                                     java.util.List<java.lang.String> defaultValue,
                                     @Nullable
                                     java.lang.String description,
                                     @Nullable
                                     PropertyValidator<? super java.util.List<java.lang.String>> validator)
        Add a list-of-strings property to the schema.

        Even if no validator is provided, the schema will validate that the configuration property, if present, contains a list of strings without any null values.

        If a defaultValue is provided, then the provided validator, if any, will only be invoked if the value is present (i.e. it will not be provided a null value to validate).

        Parameters:
        key - The configuration property key.
        defaultValue - A default value for the property or null if no default is provided.
        description - The description to associate with this property, or null if no documentation is provided.
        validator - A validator for the property, or null if no validator is provided.
        Returns:
        This builder.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the key cannot be parsed.
